'The men’s room' guanya el premi al millor documental internacional a l'In-Edit
El festival també guardona 'Niños somos todos' i 'Gay Mercader: el gran mercader del rock and roll'

03 Nov 2019, 15:29

'The men’s room', de Petter Sommer i Jo Vemund Svendsena, ha guanyat el premi al millor documental internacional de la 17a edició del Festival de Documental Musical In-Edit, que s'ha celebrat a Barcelona. 'The men's room' és l'emocionant dia a dia d'un cor d'homes noruecs que mentre assaja per al concert de la seva vida, en què han de telonejar Black Sabbath, reben l'impacte de saber que el seu director s'està morint de càncer.



The Men's Room - Official Trailer from Fuglene on Vimeo.
En la secció nacional, l'In-Edit ha premiat 'Niños somos todos', de Sergi Cameron, que segueix el Niño de Elche de viatge per Bolívia, i ha fet una menció especial per a 'Gay Mercader: el gran mercader del rock and roll', dirigit per Montse Mompó i Pilar Ruiz Cruz. A més, 'Les Resilients', de Cristina Madrid, ha guanyat el premi al millor documental talent jove. 
Les projeccions de l'edició 2019 de l'In-Edit han tingut 34.000 espectadors (inclosos els 4.000 de l'edició a Madrid), segons les xifres facilitades pel festival. Cristian Pascual, que fins ara era el director de l'In-Edit, deixa el càrrec i serà substituït per Uri Altell, cofundador del festival. Pascual deixa la direcció perquè es trasllada a Xile per motius familiars.
text:
'The men's room' wins the prize for the best international documentary for In-Edit
The festival also awards 'Niños somos todos' and 'Gay Mercader: the great merchant of rock and roll'

03 Nov 2019, 15:29

The men's room, by Petter Sommer and Jo Vemund Svendsena, has won the prize for the best international documentary for the 17th edition of the In-Edit Musical Documentary Festival, held in Barcelona. 'The men's room' is the exciting day-to-day performance of a Norwegian men's choir that while rehearsing for the concert of their lives, they have to blacklist Black Sabbath, they have the impact of knowing that their director is 'is dying of cancer.



The Men's Room - Official Trailer from Fuglene on Vimeo.
In the national section, In-Edit has awarded 'Niños somos todos', by Sergi Cameron, who follows Elche's boy on a trip to Bolivia, and made a special mention for' Gay Mercader: the great merchant of rock and roll ', directed by Montse Mompó and Pilar Ruiz Cruz. In addition, 'Las Resilients', by Cristina Madrid, has won the award for best young talent documentary.
The 2019 edition of the In-Edit projections have had 34,000 viewers (including 4,000 of the edition in Madrid), according to the figures provided by the festival. Cristian Pascual, who until now was the director of In-Edit, leaves the post and will be replaced by Uri Altell, co-founder of the festival. Pascual leaves the address because he moves to Chile for family reasons.
